page.title: 06BUILDINGS Sussex Windmills
page.content: There are two windmills in Cross-in- Hand,both are privately owned. "New Mill " is found on a hill in a field. Originally built in 1806 at Mount Ephraim in Uckfield,it was moved to Cross-in-Hand in 1855 and to its present site in 1868.It has been damaged at various times by gales and lightning and then repaired. The sails were taken down in 1976, only two are left.It is an iron-sheeted post mill now in poor condition, though restoration is underway. "Old Mill" is found just south west of "New Mill", it was built in the early 18th century and demolished about 1905.It is a postmill with only a one story round house remaining.It is now used as a store. (Annette Drinkwater, Michelle Johns, Andrew Ellis, Michael Harwood.)
